meanings.definition: A small fish that has a suction cup-like structure on its belly to cling to rocks and other surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The clingfish swam gracefully among the rocks.
meanings.sent2: I saw a colorful clingfish attached to the rock.
meanings.sent3: The clingfish tried to stick to the glass of the aquarium, thinking it was a rock.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a clingfish clinging to its favorite spot.
meanings.sent5: The clingfish's ability to hold on tightly amazed the onlookers.

meanings.definition: To cling or adhere tightly to something, like a clingfish to a rock.
meanings.sent1: She would clingfish to her beliefs no matter what.
meanings.sent2: The wet clothes would clingfish to his skin after swimming.
meanings.sent3: The sticker refused to clingfish to the paper, causing frustration.
meanings.sent4: His memories would clingfish to his mind like a stubborn stain.
meanings.sent5: The idea of success would clingfish to her thoughts, driving her forward.
